segment.source: Scenario 1 Online Activation (Windows 10)
segment.target: Scenario 1 Online Activation (Windows 10)

segment.source: Scenario 1 Online Activation
segment.target: Scenario 1 Online Activation

segment.source: Scenario 1: Online Activation
segment.target: Scenario 1: Online Activation

segment.source: In this scenario, the Volume Activation Management Tool (VAMT) is deployed in the Core Network environment.
segment.target: In this scenario, the Volume Activation Management Tool (VAMT) is deployed in the Core Network environment.

segment.source: VAMT is installed on a central computer that has network access to all of the client computers.
segment.target: VAMT is installed on a central computer that has network access to all of the client computers.

segment.source: Both the VAMT host and the client computers have Internet access.
segment.target: Both the VAMT host and the client computers have Internet access.

segment.source: The following illustration shows a diagram of an online activation scenario for Multiple Activation Keys (MAKs).
segment.target: The following illustration shows a diagram of an online activation scenario for Multiple Activation Keys (MAKs).

segment.source: You can use this scenario for online activation of the following key types:
segment.target: You can use this scenario for online activation of the following key types:

segment.source: Multiple Activation Key (MAK)
segment.target: Multiple Activation Key (MAK)

segment.source: Windows Key Management Service (KMS) keys:
segment.target: Windows Key Management Service (KMS) keys:

segment.source: KMS Host key (CSVLK)
segment.target: KMS Host key (CSVLK)

segment.source: Generic Volume License Key (GVLK), or KMS client key
segment.target: Generic Volume License Key (GVLK), or KMS client key

segment.source: Retail The Secure Zone represents higher-security Core Network computers that have additional firewall protection.
segment.target: Retail The Secure Zone represents higher-security Core Network computers that have additional firewall protection.

segment.source: VAMT firewall configuration for multiple subnets
segment.target: VAMT firewall configuration for multiple subnets

segment.source: In This Topic
segment.target: In This Topic

segment.source: Install and start VAMT on a networked host computer
segment.target: Install and start VAMT on a networked host computer

segment.source: Configure the Windows Management Instrumentation firewall exception on target computers
segment.target: Configure the Windows Management Instrumentation firewall exception on target computers

segment.source: Connect to VAMT database
segment.target: Connect to VAMT database

segment.source: Discover products
segment.target: Discover products

segment.source: Sort and filter the list of computers
segment.target: Sort and filter the list of computers

segment.source: Collect status information from the computers in the list
segment.target: Collect status information from the computers in the list

segment.source: Add product keys and determine the remaining activation count
segment.target: Add product keys and determine the remaining activation count

segment.source: Install the product keys
segment.target: Install the product keys

segment.source: Activate the client products
segment.target: Activate the client products

segment.source: Step 1: Install and start VAMT on a networked host computer
segment.target: Step 1: Install and start VAMT on a networked host computer

segment.source: Install VAMT on the host computer.
segment.target: Install VAMT on the host computer.

segment.source: Click the VAMT icon in the Start menu to open VAMT.
segment.target: Click the VAMT icon in the Start menu to open VAMT.

segment.source: Step 2: Configure the Windows Management Instrumentation firewall exception on target computers
segment.target: Step 2: Configure the Windows Management Instrumentation firewall exception on target computers

segment.source: Ensure that the Windows Management Instrumentation (WMI) firewall exception has been enabled for all target computers.
segment.target: Ensure that the Windows Management Instrumentation (WMI) firewall exception has been enabled for all target computers.

segment.source: For more information, see Configure Client Computers.
segment.target: For more information, see Configure Client Computers.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: To retrieve product license status, VAMT must have administrative permissions on the remote computers and WMI must be available through the Windows Firewall.
segment.target: To retrieve product license status, VAMT must have administrative permissions on the remote computers and WMI must be available through the Windows Firewall.

segment.source: In addition, for workgroup computers, a registry key must be created to enable remote administrative actions under User Account Control (UAC).
segment.target: In addition, for workgroup computers, a registry key must be created to enable remote administrative actions under User Account Control (UAC).

segment.source: For more information, see Configure Client Computers.
segment.target: For more information, see Configure Client Computers.

segment.source: Step 3: Connect to a VAMT database
segment.target: Step 3: Connect to a VAMT database

segment.source: If you are not already connected to a database, the Database Connection Settings dialog box appears when you open VAMT.
segment.target: If you are not already connected to a database, the Database Connection Settings dialog box appears when you open VAMT.

segment.source: Select the server and database where the keys that must be activated are located.
segment.target: Select the server and database where the keys that must be activated are located.

segment.source: Click Connect.
segment.target: Click Connect.

segment.source: If you are already connected to a database, VAMT displays an inventory of the products and product keys in the center pane, and a license overview of the computers in the database.
segment.target: If you are already connected to a database, VAMT displays an inventory of the products and product keys in the center pane, and a license overview of the computers in the database.

segment.source: If you need to connect to a different database, click Successfully connected to Server to open the Database Connection Settings dialog box.
segment.target: If you need to connect to a different database, click Successfully connected to Server to open the Database Connection Settings dialog box.

segment.source: For more information about how to create VAMT databases and adding VAMT data, see Manage VAMT Data
segment.target: For more information about how to create VAMT databases and adding VAMT data, see Manage VAMT Data

segment.source: Step 4: Discover products
segment.target: Step 4: Discover products

segment.source: In the left-side pane, in the Products node Products, click the product that you want to activate.
segment.target: In the left-side pane, in the Products node Products, click the product that you want to activate.

segment.source: To open the Discover Products dialog box, click Discover products in the Actions menu in the right-side pane.
segment.target: To open the Discover Products dialog box, click Discover products in the Actions menu in the right-side pane.

segment.source: In the Discover Products dialog box, click Search for computers in the Active Directory to display the search options, and then click the search options that you want to use.
segment.target: In the Discover Products dialog box, click Search for computers in the Active Directory to display the search options, and then click the search options that you want to use.

segment.source: You can search for computers in an Active Directory domain, by individual computer name or IP address, in a workgroup, or by a general Lightweight Directory Access Protocol (LDAP) query:
segment.target: You can search for computers in an Active Directory domain, by individual computer name or IP address, in a workgroup, or by a general Lightweight Directory Access Protocol (LDAP) query:

segment.source: To search for computers in an Active Directory domain, click Search for computers in the Active Directory.
segment.target: To search for computers in an Active Directory domain, click Search for computers in the Active Directory.

segment.source: Then under Domain Filter Criteria, in the list of domain names click the name of the domain that you want to search.
segment.target: Then under Domain Filter Criteria, in the list of domain names click the name of the domain that you want to search.

segment.source: You can narrow the search further by typing a name in the Filter by computer name field to search for specific computers in the domain.
segment.target: You can narrow the search further by typing a name in the Filter by computer name field to search for specific computers in the domain.

segment.source: This filter supports the asterisk () wildcard.
segment.target: This filter supports the asterisk () wildcard.

segment.source: For example, typing "a" will display only those computer names that start with the letter "a".
segment.target: For example, typing "a" will display only those computer names that start with the letter "a".

segment.source: To search by individual computer name or IP address, click Manually enter name or IP address.
segment.target: To search by individual computer name or IP address, click Manually enter name or IP address.

segment.source: Then enter the full name or IP address in the One or more computer names or IP addresses separated by commas text box.
segment.target: Then enter the full name or IP address in the One or more computer names or IP addresses separated by commas text box.

segment.source: Separate multiple entries with a comma.
segment.target: Separate multiple entries with a comma.

segment.source: Note that VAMT supports both IPv4 and IPV6 addressing.
segment.target: Note that VAMT supports both IPv4 and IPV6 addressing.

segment.source: To search for computers in a workgroup, click Search for computers in the workgroup.
segment.target: To search for computers in a workgroup, click Search for computers in the workgroup.

segment.source: Then under Workgroup Filter Criteria, in the list of workgroup names, click the name of the workgroup that you want to search.
segment.target: Then under Workgroup Filter Criteria, in the list of workgroup names, click the name of the workgroup that you want to search.

segment.source: You can narrow the search further by typing a name in the Filter by computer name field to search for a specific computer in the workgroup.
segment.target: You can narrow the search further by typing a name in the Filter by computer name field to search for a specific computer in the workgroup.

segment.source: This filter supports the asterisk () wildcard.
segment.target: This filter supports the asterisk () wildcard.

segment.source: For example, typing "a" will display only computer names that start with the letter "a".
segment.target: For example, typing "a" will display only computer names that start with the letter "a".

segment.source: To search for computers by using a general LDAP query, click Search with LDAP query and enter your query in the text box that appears.
segment.target: To search for computers by using a general LDAP query, click Search with LDAP query and enter your query in the text box that appears.

segment.source: VAMT will validate the LDAP query syntax, but will otherwise run the query without additional checks.
segment.target: VAMT will validate the LDAP query syntax, but will otherwise run the query without additional checks.

segment.source: Click Search.
segment.target: Click Search.

segment.source: When the search is complete, the products that VAMT discovers appear in the product list view in the center pane.
segment.target: When the search is complete, the products that VAMT discovers appear in the product list view in the center pane.

segment.source: Step 5: Sort and filter the list of computers
segment.target: Step 5: Sort and filter the list of computers

segment.source: You can sort the list of products so that it is easier to find the computers that require product keys to be activated:
segment.target: You can sort the list of products so that it is easier to find the computers that require product keys to be activated:

segment.source: On the menu bar at the top of the center pane, click Group by, and then click Product, Product Key Type, or License Status.
segment.target: On the menu bar at the top of the center pane, click Group by, and then click Product, Product Key Type, or License Status.

segment.source: To sort the list further, you can click one of the column headings to sort by that column.
segment.target: To sort the list further, you can click one of the column headings to sort by that column.

segment.source: You can also use the Filter function to narrow your search for computers by clicking Filter in the right-side pane to open the Filter Products dialog box.
segment.target: You can also use the Filter function to narrow your search for computers by clicking Filter in the right-side pane to open the Filter Products dialog box.

segment.source: In the Filter Products dialog box, you can filter the list by computer name, product name, product key type, license status, or by any combination of these options.
segment.target: In the Filter Products dialog box, you can filter the list by computer name, product name, product key type, license status, or by any combination of these options.

segment.source: To filter the list by computer name, enter a name in the Computer Name box.
segment.target: To filter the list by computer name, enter a name in the Computer Name box.

segment.source: To filter the list by product name, product key type, or license status, click the list you want to use for the filter and select an option.
segment.target: To filter the list by product name, product key type, or license status, click the list you want to use for the filter and select an option.

segment.source: If necessary, click clear all filters to create a new filter.
segment.target: If necessary, click clear all filters to create a new filter.

segment.source: Click Filter.
segment.target: Click Filter.

segment.source: VAMT displays the filtered list in the product list view in the center pane.
segment.target: VAMT displays the filtered list in the product list view in the center pane.

segment.source: Step 6: Collect status information from the computers in the list
segment.target: Step 6: Collect status information from the computers in the list

segment.source: To collect the status from select computers in the database, you can select computers in the product list view by using one of the following methods:
segment.target: To collect the status from select computers in the database, you can select computers in the product list view by using one of the following methods:

segment.source: To select a block of consecutively listed computers, click the first computer that you want to select, and then click the last computer while pressing the Shift key.
segment.target: To select a block of consecutively listed computers, click the first computer that you want to select, and then click the last computer while pressing the Shift key.

segment.source: To select computers which are not listed consecutively, hold down the Ctrl key and select each computer for which you want to collect the status information.
segment.target: To select computers which are not listed consecutively, hold down the Ctrl key and select each computer for which you want to collect the status information.

segment.source: To collect status information from the selected computers
segment.target: To collect status information from the selected computers

segment.source: In the right-side Actions pane, click Update license status in the Selected Items menu and then click a credential option.
segment.target: In the right-side Actions pane, click Update license status in the Selected Items menu and then click a credential option.

segment.source: Choose Alternate Credentials only if you are updating products that require administrator credentials that are different from the ones that you used to log on to the computer.
segment.target: Choose Alternate Credentials only if you are updating products that require administrator credentials that are different from the ones that you used to log on to the computer.

segment.source: Otherwise, click Current Credentials and continue to step 2.If you are supplying alternate credentials, in the Windows Security dialog box, type the appropriate user name and password and then click OK.
segment.target: Otherwise, click Current Credentials and continue to step 2.If you are supplying alternate credentials, in the Windows Security dialog box, type the appropriate user name and password and then click OK.

segment.source: VAMT displays the Collecting product information dialog box while it collects the license status of all supported products on the selected computers.
segment.target: VAMT displays the Collecting product information dialog box while it collects the license status of all supported products on the selected computers.

segment.source: When the process is finished, the updated license status of each product will appear in the product list view in the center pane.
segment.target: When the process is finished, the updated license status of each product will appear in the product list view in the center pane.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: If a computer has more than one supported product installed, VAMT adds an entry for each product.
segment.target: If a computer has more than one supported product installed, VAMT adds an entry for each product.

segment.source: The entry appears under the appropriate product heading.
segment.target: The entry appears under the appropriate product heading.

segment.source: Step 7: Add product keys and determine the remaining activation count
segment.target: Step 7: Add product keys and determine the remaining activation count

segment.source: Click the Product Keys node in the left-side pane, and then click Add Product Keys in the right-side pane to open the Add Product Keys dialog box.
segment.target: Click the Product Keys node in the left-side pane, and then click Add Product Keys in the right-side pane to open the Add Product Keys dialog box.

segment.source: In the Add Product Key dialog box, you can select from one of the following methods to add product keys:
segment.target: In the Add Product Key dialog box, you can select from one of the following methods to add product keys:

segment.source: To add product keys manually, click Enter product key(s) separated by line breaks, enter one or more product keys, and then click Add Key(s).
segment.target: To add product keys manually, click Enter product key(s) separated by line breaks, enter one or more product keys, and then click Add Key(s).

segment.source: To import a Comma Separated Values File (CSV) that contains a list of product keys, click Select a product key file to import, browse to the file location, click Open to import the file, and then click Add Key(s).
segment.target: To import a Comma Separated Values File (CSV) that contains a list of product keys, click Select a product key file to import, browse to the file location, click Open to import the file, and then click Add Key(s).

segment.source: The keys that you have added appear in the Product Keys list view in the center pane.
segment.target: The keys that you have added appear in the Product Keys list view in the center pane.

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: If you are activating many products with a MAK, refresh the activation count of the MAK to ensure that the MAK can support the required number of activations.
segment.target: If you are activating many products with a MAK, refresh the activation count of the MAK to ensure that the MAK can support the required number of activations.

segment.source: In the product key list in the center pane, select the MAK and then click Refresh product key data online in the right-side pane to contact Microsoft and retrieve the number of remaining activations for the MAK.
segment.target: In the product key list in the center pane, select the MAK and then click Refresh product key data online in the right-side pane to contact Microsoft and retrieve the number of remaining activations for the MAK.

segment.source: This step requires Internet access.
segment.target: This step requires Internet access.

segment.source: You can only retrieve the remaining activation count for MAKs.
segment.target: You can only retrieve the remaining activation count for MAKs.

segment.source: Step 8: Install the product keys
segment.target: Step 8: Install the product keys

segment.source: In the left-side pane, click the product that you want to install keys on to.
segment.target: In the left-side pane, click the product that you want to install keys on to.

segment.source: If necessary, sort and filter the list of products so that it is easier to find the computers that must have a product key installed.
segment.target: If necessary, sort and filter the list of products so that it is easier to find the computers that must have a product key installed.

segment.source: See Step 5: Sort and filter the list of computers.
segment.target: See Step 5: Sort and filter the list of computers.

segment.source: In the Products list view pane, select the individual products which must have keys installed.
segment.target: In the Products list view pane, select the individual products which must have keys installed.

segment.source: You can use the CTRL key or the SHIFT key to select more than one product.
segment.target: You can use the CTRL key or the SHIFT key to select more than one product.

segment.source: Click Install product key in the Selected Items menu in the right-side pane to display the Install Product Key dialog box.
segment.target: Click Install product key in the Selected Items menu in the right-side pane to display the Install Product Key dialog box.

segment.source: The Select Product Key dialog box displays the keys that are available to be installed.
segment.target: The Select Product Key dialog box displays the keys that are available to be installed.

segment.source: Under Recommended MAKs, VAMT might display one or more recommended MAKs based on the selected products.
segment.target: Under Recommended MAKs, VAMT might display one or more recommended MAKs based on the selected products.

segment.source: If you are installing a MAK you can select a recommended product key or any other MAK from the All Product Keys List.
segment.target: If you are installing a MAK you can select a recommended product key or any other MAK from the All Product Keys List.

segment.source: If you are not installing a MAK, select a product key from the All Product Keys list.
segment.target: If you are not installing a MAK, select a product key from the All Product Keys list.

segment.source: Use the scroll bar if you want to view the Description for each key.
segment.target: Use the scroll bar if you want to view the Description for each key.

segment.source: When you have selected the product key that you want to install, click Install Key.
segment.target: When you have selected the product key that you want to install, click Install Key.

segment.source: Note that only one key can be installed at a time.
segment.target: Note that only one key can be installed at a time.

segment.source: VAMT displays the Installing product key dialog box while it attempts to install the product key for the selected products.
segment.target: VAMT displays the Installing product key dialog box while it attempts to install the product key for the selected products.

segment.source: When the process is finished, the status appears in the Action Status column of the dialog box.
segment.target: When the process is finished, the status appears in the Action Status column of the dialog box.

segment.source: Click Close to close the dialog box.
segment.target: Click Close to close the dialog box.

segment.source: You can also click the Automatically close when done check box when the dialog box appears.
segment.target: You can also click the Automatically close when done check box when the dialog box appears.

segment.source: The same status appears under the Status of Last Action column in the product list view in the center pane.
segment.target: The same status appears under the Status of Last Action column in the product list view in the center pane.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: Product key installation will fail if VAMT finds mismatched key types or editions.
segment.target: Product key installation will fail if VAMT finds mismatched key types or editions.

segment.source: VAMT will display the failure status and will continue the installation for the next product in the list.
segment.target: VAMT will display the failure status and will continue the installation for the next product in the list.

segment.source: For more information on choosing the correct product key, see How to Choose the Right Volume License Key for Windows.
segment.target: For more information on choosing the correct product key, see How to Choose the Right Volume License Key for Windows.

segment.source: Step 9: Activate the client products
segment.target: Step 9: Activate the client products

segment.source: Select the individual products that you want to activate in the list-view pane.
segment.target: Select the individual products that you want to activate in the list-view pane.

segment.source: On the menu bar, click Action, point to Activate and point to Online activate.
segment.target: On the menu bar, click Action, point to Activate and point to Online activate.

segment.source: You can also right-click the selected computers(s) to display the Action menu, point to Activate and point to Online activate.
segment.target: You can also right-click the selected computers(s) to display the Action menu, point to Activate and point to Online activate.

segment.source: You can also click Activate in the Selected Items menu in the right-hand pane to access the Activate option.
segment.target: You can also click Activate in the Selected Items menu in the right-hand pane to access the Activate option.

segment.source: If you are activating product keys using your current credential, click Current credential and continue to step 5.
segment.target: If you are activating product keys using your current credential, click Current credential and continue to step 5.

segment.source: If you are activating products that require an administrator credential that is different from the one you are currently using, click the Alternate credential option.
segment.target: If you are activating products that require an administrator credential that is different from the one you are currently using, click the Alternate credential option.

segment.source: Enter your alternate user name and password and click OK.
segment.target: Enter your alternate user name and password and click OK.

segment.source: The Activate option contacts the Microsoft product-activation server over the Internet and requests activation for the selected products.
segment.target: The Activate option contacts the Microsoft product-activation server over the Internet and requests activation for the selected products.

segment.source: VAMT displays the Activating products dialog box until the requested actions are completed.
segment.target: VAMT displays the Activating products dialog box until the requested actions are completed.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: Installing a MAK and overwriting the GVLK on client products must be done with care.
segment.target: Installing a MAK and overwriting the GVLK on client products must be done with care.

segment.source: If the RTM version of Windows Vista has been installed on the computer for more than 30 days, then its initial grace period has expired.
segment.target: If the RTM version of Windows Vista has been installed on the computer for more than 30 days, then its initial grace period has expired.

segment.source: As a result, it will enter Reduced Functionality Mode (RFM) if online activation is not completed successfully before the next logon attempt.
segment.target: As a result, it will enter Reduced Functionality Mode (RFM) if online activation is not completed successfully before the next logon attempt.

segment.source: However, you can use online activation to recover properly configured computers from RFM, as long as the computers are available on the network.
segment.target: However, you can use online activation to recover properly configured computers from RFM, as long as the computers are available on the network.

segment.source: RFM only applies to the RTM version of Windows Vista or the retail editions of Microsoft Office 2010.
segment.target: RFM only applies to the RTM version of Windows Vista or the retail editions of Microsoft Office 2010.

segment.source: Windows Vista with SP1 or later, Windows 7, Windows 8, Windows 10, Windows Server 2008, Windows Server 2008 R2, Windows Server 2012, and volume editions of Office 2010 will not enter RFM.
segment.target: Windows Vista with SP1 or later, Windows 7, Windows 8, Windows 10, Windows Server 2008, Windows Server 2008 R2, Windows Server 2012, and volume editions of Office 2010 will not enter RFM.

segment.source: Related topics
segment.target: Related topics

segment.source: VAMT Step-by-Step Scenarios
segment.target: VAMT Step-by-Step Scenarios
